name: Hattler et al. v. Wayne County, Appellant

judges: Before Frazer, C. J., Schaffer, Maxey, Drew, Linn and Barnes, JJ.
parties: Hattler et al. v. Wayne County, Appellant.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
A majority of the judges who heard the argument in this case are of opinion the decree of the Superior Court should be affirmed on the opinion of Judge Parker.
Judgment affirmed.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Paul G. Collins, with him Frank L. Martin, for appellant.
A. G. Rutherford, with him Ira B. Rutherford and James Rutherford, for appellees.
casebody.head_matter:
Hattler et al. v. Wayne County, Appellant.
Argued December 3, 1935.
Before Frazer, C. J., Schaffer, Maxey, Drew, Linn and Barnes, JJ.
January 6, 1936:
Paul G. Collins, with him Frank L. Martin, for appellant.
A. G. Rutherford, with him Ira B. Rutherford and James Rutherford, for appellees.
